intro: Geissorhiza lithicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Geissorhiza lithicola is well adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
